summary.long: 2 Peter is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Simeon Peter, a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ,
To those who have received a faith as equally honorable as ours through the righteousness of our God and Savior Jesus Christ:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May grace and peace be yours in abundance in the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His divine power has given us everything needed for life and godliness, through the knowledge of him who called us by his own glory and excellence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus he has given us, through these things, his precious and very great promises, so that through them you may escape from the corruption that is in the world because of lust and may become participants of the divine nature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this very reason, you must make every effort to support your faith with excellence, and excellence with knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and knowledge with self-control, and self-control with endurance, and endurance with godliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and godliness with mutual affection, and mutual affection with love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if these things are yours and are increasing among you, they keep you from being ineffective and unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For anyone who lacks these things is blind, suffering from eye disease, forgetful of the cleansing of past sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, brothers and sisters, be all the more eager to confirm your call and election, for if you do this, you will never stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this way, entry into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ will be richly provided for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I intend to keep on reminding you of these things, though you know them already and are established in the truth that has come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I think it right, as long as I am in this body, to refresh your memory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since I know that my death will come soon, as indeed our Lord Jesus Christ has made clear to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make every effort so that after my departure you may be able at any time to recall these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we did not follow cleverly devised myths when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we had been eyewitnesses of his majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he received honor and glory from God the Father when that voice was conveyed to him by the Majestic Glory, saying, “This is my Son, my Beloved, with whom I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We ourselves heard this voice come from heaven, while we were with him on the holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we have the prophetic message more fully confirmed. You will do well to be attentive to this as to a lamp shining in a dark place, until the day dawns and the morning star rises in your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: First of all you must understand this, that no prophecy of scripture is a matter of one’s own interpretation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because no prophecy ever came by human will, but men and women moved by the Holy Spirit spoke from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But false prophets also arose among the people, just as there will be false teachers among you, who will secretly bring in destructive opinions. They will even deny the Master who bought them—bringing swift destruction on themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so, many will follow their debaucheries, and because of these teachers the way of truth will be maligned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in their greed they will exploit you with deceptive words. Their condemnation, pronounced against them long ago, has not been idle, and their destruction is not asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if God did not spare the angels when they sinned but cast them into hell and committed them to chains of deepest darkness to be kept until the judgment;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he did not spare the ancient world, even though he saved Noah, a herald of righteousness, with seven others, when he brought a flood on the world of the ungodly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if by turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah to ashes he condemned them to destruction and made them an example of what is coming to the ungodly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he rescued Lot, a righteous man greatly distressed by the debauchery of the lawless
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for that righteous man, living among them day after day, was tormented in his righteous soul by their lawless deeds that he saw and heard),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord knows how to rescue the godly from trial and to keep the unrighteous until the day of judgment, when they will be punished
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
—especially those who indulge their flesh in depraved lust and who despise authority.
Bold and willful, they are not afraid to slander the glorious ones,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whereas angels, though greater in might and power, do not bring against them a slanderous judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people, however, are like irrational animals, mere creatures of instinct, born to be caught and killed. They slander what they do not understand, and as those creatures are destroyed, they also will be destroyed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: suffering the wages of doing wrong. They count it a pleasure to revel in the daytime. They are blots and blemishes, reveling in their pleasures while they feast with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have eyes full of adultery, insatiable for sin. They entice unsteady souls. They have hearts trained in greed. Accursed children!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have left the straight road and have gone astray, following the road of Balaam son of Bosor, who loved the wages of doing wrong
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but was rebuked for his own transgression; a speechless donkey spoke with a human voice and restrained the prophet’s madness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are waterless springs and mists driven by a storm; for them the deepest darkness has been reserved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they speak bombastic nonsense, and with debased desires of the flesh they entice people who have just escaped from those who live in error.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They promise them freedom, but they themselves are slaves of corruption, for people are slaves to whatever masters them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if, after they have escaped the defilements of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, they are again entangled in them and overpowered, the last state has become worse for them than the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it would have been better for them never to have known the way of righteousness than, after knowing it, to turn back from the holy commandment that was handed on to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It has happened to them according to the true proverb,
“The dog turns back to its own vomit,”
and,
“The sow is washed only to wallow in the mud.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is now, beloved, the second letter I am writing to you; in them I am trying to arouse your sincere intention by reminding you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you should remember the words spoken in the past by the holy prophets and the commandment of the Lord and Savior spoken through your apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: First of all you must understand this, that in the last days scoffers will come, scoffing and indulging their own lusts
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “Where is the promise of his coming? For ever since our ancestors died, all things continue as they were from the beginning of creation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They deliberately ignore this fact, that by the word of God heavens existed long ago and an earth was formed out of water and by means of water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: through which the world of that time was deluged with water and perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But by the same word the present heavens and earth have been reserved for fire, being kept until the day of judgment and destruction of the godless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But do not ignore this one fact, beloved, that with the Lord one day is like a thousand years, and a thousand years are like one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is not slow about his promise, as some think of slowness, but is patient with you, not wanting any to perish but all to come to repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the day of the Lord will come like a thief, and then the heavens will pass away with a loud noise, and the elements will be destroyed with fire, and the earth and everything that is done on it will be disclosed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since all these things are to be destroyed in this way, what sort of persons ought you to be in leading lives of holiness and godliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: waiting for and hastening the coming of the day of God, because of which the heavens will be set ablaze and destroyed and the elements will melt with fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But, in accordance with his promise, we wait for new heavens and a new earth, where righteousness is at home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, beloved, while you are waiting for these things, strive to be found by him at peace, without spot or blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and regard the patience of our Lord as salvation. So also our beloved brother Paul wrote to you according to the wisdom given him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: speaking of this as he does in all his letters. There are some things in them hard to understand, which the ignorant and unstable twist to their own destruction, as they do the other scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You therefore, beloved, since you are forewarned, beware that you are not carried away with the error of the lawless and lose your own stability.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To him be the glory both now and to the day of eternity. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
